news.title: Race to the Áras: Campaigning kicks off at Ploughing; Taoiseach insists McGregor White House visit not ‘humiliating’
news.summary: The presidential race has narrowed, with a number of local authorities deciding not to nominate any potential Independent candidates… and presidential candidates are pulling on their wellies, and hopefully leaving the white trousers at home, for a day at the Ploughing.

news.title: Barne Estate case: ‘War’ between two rich men, €50k in brown envelopes and John Magnier’s ‘shifting sands’ stories
news.summary: A number of witnesses in the Barne Estate case characterised the dispute as a “war” between two rich and powerful men.

news.title: Met Éireann extends Status Yellow rain warning to nine counties with likely flooding
news.summary: Met Éireann has extended its Status Yellow rain warning to nine counties, bringing the risk of spot flooding on Tuesday and Wednesday.

news.title: Presidential race: Number’s up for mathematician, lawyer and professor as hopes are thwarted by council
news.summary: It had been a long day, and it felt like spirits had begun to flag in Roscommon council chamber as councillors heard from a myriad of presidential hopefuls.

news.title: ‘I trained hard for him. Morning, noon and night’ – When an Irishman became first boxer to knock down Ricky Hatton
news.summary: The details in Eamonn Magee’s battered head are fuzzy now but the picture tells its own grisly story.

news.title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, independent UN inquiry finds
news.summary: A United Nations Commission of Inquiry concluded on Tuesday that Israel has committed genocide in Gaza and that top Israeli officials including Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had incited these acts.

news.title: ‘I had notions that I could do this on the side but it is very much a full-time job’ – the Westmeath dairy couple selling their milk from vending machines
news.summary: When Eimear and Francis Nally went on their honeymoon in 2015, they didn’t think they would come home with a business idea for their Westmeath dairy farm.

news.title: Taoiseach criticises Soc Dems ‘lecturing’ after Eoin Hayes ‘blackface’ pictures emerge
news.summary: The Taoiseach has criticised the Social Democrats for “lecturing” other parties on “proper behaviour” after photos emerged of its TD Eoin Hayes in ‘blackface’ as Barack Obama when he was a student.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s restaurant review: Ring the doorbell to this Dublin restaurant and take the stairs to superb Brazilian-style dining
news.summary: Amai by Viktor is located on Dublin’s Harry Street. Set on the first floor over The Corkscrew Wine Merchants.

news.title: Louis Chilton: Despite some surprises, Emmys results show exactly what modern TV is lacking
news.summary: To the surprise of no one, the big winner during Sunday night’s Emmys was  Adolescence . The four-episode British drama, about a radicalised teenage boy who murders a female classmate, was met with wall-to-wall praise when it debuted on Netflix in March, dominating news headlines and instigating wide-ranging public debate.
